Discussion Topic

Encourage parents to become more aware of when and how often they praise their children. The exercise below is an activity that can be used with parents. Using the scale below, encourage parents to evaluate themselves on their use of praise.

Rating Exercise:

1. I try to make play a positive experience by praising my child's efforts.

(Rarely, Sometimes, Never)

2. I encourage my child by praising effort and good behavior.

(Rarely, Sometimes, Never)

3. I give hugs or high fives for accomplishments.

(Rarely, Sometimes, Never)

4. I try to recognize what interests my child and acknowledge the

value of the activity.

(Rarely, Sometimes, Never)

5. I put my child's artwork in easy-to-see places.

(Rarely, Sometimes, Never)

Sample Feedback

Be sure to let parents know this activity is not intended to make them feel like bad parents, instead it is to help them be aware of how often they praise so that they can make improvements if needed. Once parents have rated themselves, help them create a goal for improvement based on their ratings.
